item.title: Data Visualization: Inequality of COVID-19 Vaccinations
item.description: As developed countries head for booster shots, a rising concern on the inequality of COVID-19 vaccines distributions is coming to surface. Is this concern, however, exaggerated? Percentage of People Fully Vaccinated Source: Our World in Data Well… It’s not. As Portugal nears 75% of full vaccination rates on its population, there are still countries not reaching 1%. Perhaps unsurprisingly, African countries rate among the worse, as only 3% of the continent’s population is fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

item.title: Implementing a Trading Algorithm

item.title: Predicting Employee Attrition
item.description: The problem: IFM Healthcare’s employee attrition rate was at 15%, almost twice the industry’s benchmark rate. Given high attrition levels could bring all sort of costs to the firm, an employee retention plan was put in place. For the solution design, we were given a budget of $1M to implement the salary raise policy, with the following insight: a 20% salary increase would reduce the probability of attrition to 0. The goal was to target the most productive employees that had also higher chances to leave the firm.

item.title: Event Study Framework
item.description: Motivation: Oftentimes, certain extremely unexpected events can’t but shake a market as it is: Brexit, the Panama papers release, Donald Trump’s election in 2016, to name a few… How can we study the impact of such events on the valuation of firms directly involved in these situations? In this notebook, I aim to present a guide on how to perform an event study, using Python. More specifically, I provide a framework on how to compute Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM) adjusted returns, which is a measure widely used academically to perform such studies.
